mdRecord.dcterms:title: A Documentary history of American industrial society / ed. by John R. Commons, Ulrich B. Phillips, Eugene A. Gilmore, Helen L. Sumner, and John B. Andrews. Prepared under the auspices of the American Bureau of Industrial Research, with the co-operation of the Carnegie Institution of Washington. With preface by Richard T. Ely and introduction by John B. Clark
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: American Bureau of Industrial Research.
Andrews, John B. (John Bertram), 1880-1943
Carnegie Institution of Washington.
Commons, John R. (John Rogers), 1862-1945
Gilmore, Eugene Allen, 1871-1953
Phillips, Ulrich Bonnell, 1877-1934
Sumner, Helen L. (Helen Laura), 1876-1933
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 11 volumes frontispieces (volumes 5-10) portraits, chart, facsimiles (1 folded) folded table 25 cm
mdRecord.dcterms:description: v. 1-2. Plantation and frontier -- v. 3-4. Labor conspiracy cases, 1806-1842 -- v. 5-6. Labor movement, 1820-1840 -- v. 7-8. Labor movement 1840-1860 -- v. 9-10. Labor movement, 1860-1880.
Includes bibliographical references (v. 1, p. [105]-107; v. 5, p. [39] "References": v. 7, p. [151] "Finding list of sources quoted": v. 10, p. [137]-155).
